models.name: providers/openai/models/gpt-5.1
models.description: GPT-5.1 is our flagship model for coding and agentic tasks with configurable reasoning and non-reasoning effort.

models.name: providers/openai/models/gpt-5-pro
models.description: GPT-5 pro uses more compute to think harder and provide consistently better answers. GPT-5 pro is available in the Responses API only to enable support for multi-turn model interactions before responding to API requests, and other advanced API features in the future. Since GPT-5 pro is designed to tackle tough problems, some requests may take several minutes to finish. To avoid timeouts, try using background mode. As our most advanced reasoning model, GPT-5 pro defaults to (and only supports) reasoning.effort: high. GPT-5 pro does not support code interpreter.

models.name: providers/openai/models/gpt-5-mini
models.description: GPT-5 mini is a faster, more cost-efficient version of GPT-5. It's great for well-defined tasks and precise prompts.

models.name: providers/openai/models/gpt-5-nano
models.description: GPT-5 Nano is our fastest, cheapest version of GPT-5. It's great for summarization and classification tasks.

models.name: providers/openai/models/gpt-4.1
models.description: GPT-4.1 excels at instruction following and tool calling, with broad knowledge across domains. It features a 1M token context window, and low latency without a reasoning step. Note that we recommend starting with GPT-5 for complex tasks.

models.name: providers/openai/models/gpt-5.1-2025-11-13
models.description: GPT-5.1 is our flagship model for coding and agentic tasks with configurable reasoning and non-reasoning effort.

models.name: providers/openai/models/gpt-5-mini-2025-08-07
models.description: GPT-5 mini is a faster, more cost-efficient version of GPT-5. It's great for well-defined tasks and precise prompts.

models.name: providers/openai/models/gpt-5-nano-2025-08-07
models.description: GPT-5 Nano is our fastest, cheapest version of GPT-5. It's great for summarization and classification tasks.

models.name: providers/openai/models/gpt-4.1-2025-04-14
models.description: GPT-4.1 excels at instruction following and tool calling, with broad knowledge across domains. It features a 1M token context window, and low latency without a reasoning step. Note that we recommend starting with GPT-5 for complex tasks.

models.name: providers/openai/models/gpt-5-pro-2025-10-06
models.description: GPT-5 pro uses more compute to think harder and provide consistently better answers. GPT-5 pro is available in the Responses API only to enable support for multi-turn model interactions before responding to API requests, and other advanced API features in the future. Since GPT-5 pro is designed to tackle tough problems, some requests may take several minutes to finish. To avoid timeouts, try using background mode. As our most advanced reasoning model, GPT-5 pro defaults to (and only supports) reasoning.effort: high. GPT-5 pro does not support code interpreter.

models.name: providers/openai/models/whisper-1
models.description: Whisper is a general-purpose speech recognition model, trained on a large dataset of diverse audio. You can also use it as a multitask model to perform multilingual speech recognition as well as speech translation and language identification.

models.name: providers/openai/models/tts-1
models.description: TTS is a model that converts text to natural sounding spoken text. The tts-1 model is optimized for realtime text-to-speech use cases. Use it with the Speech endpoint in the Audio API.

models.name: providers/openai/models/gpt-4o-mini-tts
models.description: GPT-4o mini TTS is a text-to-speech model built on GPT-4o mini, a fast and powerful language model. Use it to convert text to natural sounding spoken text. The maximum number of input tokens is 2000.
